question.text: Which of the following has an optical isomer?

options.text: <math><msup><mrow><mfenced close="]" open="[" separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">o</mi><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi></mrow></mfenced><msub><mrow><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></math>

<math><msup><mrow><mfenced close="]" open="[" separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">o</mi><msub><mrow><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></math>

<math><msup><mrow><mfenced close="]" open="[" separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">o</mi><msub><mrow><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi></mrow></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></math>

<math><msup><mrow><mfenced close="]" open="[" separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">o</mi><msub><mrow><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi></mrow></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></math>

solution.text: It is an octahedral complex of the type [M(AA)2X2] and capable of showing optical isomerism. As in rest others there is symmetry, so no optical isomerism is possible.
